data.name: Word Transformer
data.description:
# Word Transformer

Given two words, a start word, and an end word, along with a list of valid words (dictionary), the task is to find a sequence of transformations from the start word to the end word. A transformation sequence involves changing one letter at a time with each transformed word being present in the given dictionary.

Assume that not all input will be valid, and each word in the dictionary will match the length of `start_word` and `end_word`

## Rules

1. Words in the dictionary are lowercase and consist only of alphabetical characters.
2. The transformation sequence must follow these rules:
    * At each step, only one letter can be changed.
    * Each transformed word must exist in the dictionary.
    * The length of the start and end words will be the same.
    
## Demonstration

Consider the following case:

Start word: `"hit"`

End word: `"cog"`

Dictionary: `["hot", "dot", "dog", "lot", "log", "cog"]`

A valid transformation sequence from "hit" to "cog" can be:

"hit" -> "hot" -> "dot" -> "dog" -> "cog"

Example test case:
```rust
word_transformer("lead", "gold", &["lead", "load", "goad", "gold"])
// vec!["lead", "load", "goad", "gold"]
```

## Notes
* Not all start and end words will have valid transformation sequences. If there is no valid transformation sequence, an empty list is returned.
* The transformation sequence should adhere to the rules mentioned above, considering each intermediate word must exist in the dictionary.
